title: Check if DOIs exist — doi_exists
text: function checks given list DOIs exist sending HTTP requests DOI resolver.

title: Check if DOIs exist — doi_exists
text: dois character vector DOIs check. cache_file file name cache used, .e. confirmed existing dois. format character vector DOIs exist. cache exist, updated end.

title: Check if DOIs exist — doi_exists
text: function uses httr package send HTTP GET requests DOI resolver checks response status code. status code 200 indicates DOI exists, status code indicates DOI exist.

title: Check if DOIs exist — doi_exists
code: dois <- c("sbcd1234", "10.1234/abcd", "10.1002/jcb.23190", "10.47366/sabia.v5n1a3") doi_exists(dois) #>  Progress: 1 of 4 Progress: 2 of 4 #> Waiting 2s for throttling delay ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■                  #> Waiting 2s for throttling delay ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■   #>  Progress: 3 of 4 #> Waiting 2s for throttling delay ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■   #>  Progress: 4 of 4 #>              sbcd1234          10.1234/abcd     10.1002/jcb.23190  #>                 FALSE                 FALSE                 FALSE  #> 10.47366/sabia.v5n1a3  #>                  TRUE  # Output: [1] FALSE  TRUE

what: Check if DOIs are not retracted — doi_not_retracted
title: Check if DOIs are not retracted — doi_not_retracted
text: function checks given list DOIs (Digital Object Identifiers) retracted. uses Crossref API query Retraction Watch database.

title: Check if DOIs are not retracted — doi_not_retracted
Check if DOIs are not retracted — doi_not_retracted
text: dois character vector DOIs checked. cache_file file name cache used, .e. downloaded retraction data. file `rds` file downloaded retractionwatch site. NULL, data cached. email optional email address included API request [RECOMMENDET!].

title: Check if DOIs are not retracted — doi_not_retracted
text: named logical vector indicating whether DOI retracted (`FALSE`) (`TRUE`), names dois.

title: Check if DOIs are not retracted — doi_not_retracted
code: # Check if a single DOI is retracted doi_not_retracted("10.1234/abcd") #> 10.1234/abcd  #>         TRUE   # Check if multiple DOIs are retracted dois <- c("sbcd1234", "10.1234/abcd", "10.1002/jcb.23190", "10.47366/sabia.v5n1a3") doi_not_retracted(dois) #>              sbcd1234          10.1234/abcd     10.1002/jcb.23190  #>                  TRUE                  TRUE                 FALSE  #> 10.47366/sabia.v5n1a3  #>                  TRUE

title: Validate DOIs — doi_valid
text: function validates vector DOIs (Digital Object Identifiers) using regular expression pattern.#' taken https://github.com/libscie/retractcheck/blob/23f1e5c7d572d9470583288d951d1bad98392f82/R/utils.R#L16

title: Validate DOIs — doi_valid
text: dois vector DOIs validated.

title: Validate DOIs — doi_valid
text: named logical vector indicating whether DOI valid , names dois.

title: Validate DOIs — doi_valid
text: function uses regular expression pattern validate format DOI input vector. regular expression pattern based pattern used retractcheck package can found https://github.com/libscie/retractcheck/blob/23f1e5c7d572d9470583288d951d1bad98392f82/R/utils.R#L16. Alternatively, can uncomment second regular expression pattern comment first one use pattern rorcid package, can found https://github.com/ropensci-archive/rorcid/blob/master/R/check_dois.R.

title: Validate DOIs — doi_valid
code: dois <- c("sbcd1234", "10.1234/abcd", "10.1002/jcb.23190", "10.47366/sabia.v5n1a3") doi_valid(dois) #>              sbcd1234          10.1234/abcd     10.1002/jcb.23190  #>                 FALSE                  TRUE                  TRUE  #> 10.47366/sabia.v5n1a3  #>                  TRUE
